page.title: 09Ecology
page.content: The PENRHOS NATURE RESERVE was created after the land was purchased by the Rio Tinto Zinc company to build an aluminium processing plant.The company was persuaded by an ex police officer to gift part of the land to the community as areserve and sanctuary for injured wildlife. There has been a close liaison between the reserve and the local schools,with many children being part time wardens and guides. The warden Mr.K.Williams recieved the M.B.E.for his services to the conservation of wildlife. The reserve is open to the public throughout the year,and it is possible to ramble through wooded areas that were once part of the Conant family estate.
